airdrop.name: NFT Brand Booster
airdrop.description: Send NFTs via email or wallets. Build a whitelist, reward the most loyal users, grow your email list in exchange for rewards, or hand-pick who gets the drop.

content.title: About
content.p: Boost your visibility and grow your community with collectible NFTs.
Use this Simplet to drop branded NFTs that double as rewards, access passes, or referral incentives. Send them to emails or allow pre-approved wallets to mint—no technical setup required.

content.subtitle: How it works
content.p: Brand Booster gives you two ways to distribute NFTs:
content: Email Mint: Upload email addresses to send mint invites—perfect for onboarding newcomers.
Wallet Mint: Upload a wallet list to let selected users mint directly—ideal for loyalty rewards or whitelisted drops.

content.content: Manage everything through the admin dashboard and track who minted what.

content.subtitle: What you’ll need before you start:
content: Create an NFT collection using Apillon’s step-by-step [NFT Wizard](/dashboard/service/nft), keeping in mind that attendees will mint from that collection.
If you're using email, you’ll need your [SMTP]() details so you can send invies directly from your domain.

content.subtitle: What it’s made of:
content: Frontend: Built with Vue.js
Backend: Powered by Node.js and MySQL for data storage
Employs: Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) to keep your SMTP credentials safe

content.subtitle: How to deploy:
content: Frontend: Use Apillon GitHub integration for a quick auto-deploy directly from the [Apillon's Web3 Hosting](/dashboard/service/hosting). You can also run it locally or host it with any provider.

Backend: Use Phala Docker for a secure auto-deploy. You can also run it locally or with Docker—just configure your NFT and email setup [(see instructions on GitHub)](https://github.com/Apillon/nft-studio-simplet)

collection.empty: To get started, you’ll need at least one NFT collection in Apillon. Each Simplet needs a collection to work with—it’s where the NFTs will be minted, managed, and sent from.
collection.first: You don’t have any NFT collections yet. To continue, create one in Apillon first.
collection.info: Each Simplet needs an NFT collection to work with—it’s where the NFTs will be minted, managed, and sent from.

smtp.info: Add your SMTP settings so your emails are sent straight from your domain—no sketchy senders here.
smtp.skip: Skip email server setup for now. A default SMTP server will be pre-configured inside the Docker image. You can update the SMTP configuration later if needed.
smtp.warning: Don’t worry—your SMTP details are safe. Simplets run in a Trusted Execution Environment (TEE), which means your sensitive data stays protected. Learn more about TEEs and confidential computing.

wizard.info: You’re about to deploy a Simplet that sets up your NFT distribution dashboard. Here, you’ll manage everything—email drops, wallet airdrops, public minting, and more.

smartContracts.name: NFT Email Airdrop
smartContracts.description: Create an NFT collection, upload target addresses and automatically distribute NFTs to them.

content.title: What do you get?
content: Free metadata storage
No gas cost
Free web template
Free hosting

content.subtitle: Embedded Wallet service removes friction in user onboarding.

content.title: Benefits:
benefits: Email onboard: Simplifies the onboarding process.
A seamless and secure UX: EVM wallets are auto-created and encrypted.
Autonomy and security over funds: No third-party services to store user’s private keys.
Authentication: User can add different methods of verification.
Gasless wallet creation: charged in Apillon credits per each onboarded user.
Fully trustless. Powered by Oasis.
Free Tier to start
Receive API keys for different chains (over 100 chains supported)
over 99% uptime

nftAirdrop.name: NFT Email Airdrop
nftAirdrop.description: Create an NFT collection, upload target addresses and automatically distribute NFTs to them.

content.content: This ready-to-use solution allows you to distribute digital collectibles (NFTs) to your audience only through email addresses.

content.title: The admin panel you will set up will allow you to:
content: Add email addresses one by one or upload a file with multiple email addresses at once,
See which email addresses did and did not receive NFTs,
See wallets linked to each email,
Send automatic email instructions to each address leading to a page for claiming NFTs.

content.title: Before you start, you'll need to:
content: Create an NFT collection using [Apillon NFT Service](/dashboard/service/nft),
Know the details of email server, e. g. location and address,
Use an Ethereum-based digital wallet to access the admin panel,
Have [Apillon API key and secret](/dashboard/api-keys) to connect to the Apillon dashboard.

content.title: System setup
content: The front end is made with Vue.js,
The back end is made with Node.js and stores information in a MySQL database.

content.title: Options to run the solution
content: You can run the front end on your computer, host it on any website provider, or use [Apillon's Web3 Hosting](/dashboard/service/hosting) service via the Apillon dashboard or GitHub actions.

You can run the back end on your computer or use a tool called Docker to set configuration files with the correct information, e.g., the details of your NFTs and your email server (see instructions on [GitHub](https://github.com/Apillon/ps-email-airdrop)).

nftCollection.name: Self-hosted NFT collection
nftCollection.description: Get your self sovereign standalone NFT collection with one click. Create NFTs, deploy smart contract and finally host the collection website.

content.title: How does it work?
content.content: Launch your end-to-end decentralized NFT collection with one click. Create NFTs, deploy smart contract and host the collection website on Web3.
benefits: Free metadata storage
0 gas cost
Free web template
Free hosting

nftContentDelivery.name: NFT-Based Content Delivery
nftContentDelivery.description: Encrypt private files or assets using an NFT key. Sell or transmit the key to new owner/s and grant them access.

content.title: How does it work?
content.content:
Schrödinger’s NFT feature allows you to encrypt sensitive files of any kind using NFTs from a premade NFT collection. 

With NFT-based content delivery, you can attach different files to each NFT in the collection. The files are then encrypted using unique data from the NFT and stored on a decentralized network. 

As you sell or transfer the NFT, the new owner also obtains the encrypted file/s and can unlock its contents using the newly acquired NFT.
benefits: Selling music or audio
Selling PDFs or e-books
Selling video and other media files
Encrypting and delivering sensitive documents

nftEmailSignupAirdrop.name: NFT Email Signup Airdrop
nftEmailSignupAirdrop.description: Airdrop NFTs with a limited or unlimited supply to new and random user wallets.

content.content: This ready-to-use solution allows you to distribute digital collectibles (NFTs) to your audience only through email addresses.

content.title: The admin panel you will set up will allow you to:
content: Add email addresses one by one or upload a file with multiple email addresses at once,
See which email addresses did and did not receive NFTs,
See wallets linked to each email,
Send automatic email instructions to each address leading to a page for claiming NFTs.

content.title: Before you start, you'll need to:
content: Create an NFT collection using [Apillon NFT Service](/dashboard/service/nft),
Know the details of email server, e. g. location and address,
Use an Ethereum-based digital wallet to access the admin panel,
Have [Apillon API key and secret](/dashboard/api-keys) to connect to the Apillon dashboard.

content.title: System setup
content: The front end is made with Vue.js,
The back end is made with Node.js and stores information in a MySQL database.

content.title: Options to run the solution
content: You can run the front end on your computer, host it on any website provider, or use [Apillon's Web3 Hosting](/dashboard/service/hosting) service via the Apillon dashboard or GitHub actions.

You can run the back end on your computer or use a tool called Docker to set configuration files with the correct information, e.g., the details of your NFTs and your email server (see instructions on [GitHub](https://github.com/Apillon/ps-signup-email-airdrop)).

nftPoap.name: PoAP - Proof of Attendance NFTs
nftPoap.description: Boost your event by creating PoAP drops in a click and let users mint or email-reserve NFTs.

content.content: Proof of Attendance Protocol (PoAP) allows you to create digital keepsakes to commemorate special events and distribute them to your audience for their attendance.

content.headline: Use cases
content.title: PoAPs can serve as:
content: Digital collectibles, unique digital items that can be collected similarly to physical memorabilia
Proof of participation proving a person's attendance at an event
Reward system for engagement, participation, or contribution in an organization or event
Community boosters to encourage interaction and participation and foster a sense of community
Tradeable NFTs as a form of investment or monetization of event participation
Exclusive access to invite-only events, content, or privileges in online communities

content.headline: How does it work?
content.title: The solution consists of the admin dashboard and a webpage for claiming PoAP NFTs.
content: On the admin dashboard, you can create and manage PoAP events, see their status and statistics and link them with NFTs created on the Apillon dashboard.
The webpage is displayed at the event and allows your audience to claim their NFTs.

content.title: User flow
content: A user scans the QR code on the claim-NFT page and enters their email.
Email instructions with a link for NFT minting are sent to the email address.
The user connects their wallet and mints a PoAP NFT on the minting page.

content.title: Before you start, you'll need to:
content: Create an NFT collection using [Apillon NFT Service](/dashboard/service/nft), allowing event attendees to mint NFTs.

content.title: System setup
content: The front end is made with Vue.js,
The back end is made with Node.js and stores information in a MySQL database.

content.title: Options to run the solution
content: You can run the front end on your computer, host it on any website provider, or use [Apillon's Web3 Hosting](/dashboard/service/hosting) service via the Apillon dashboard or GitHub actions.

You can run the back end on your computer or use a tool called Docker to set configuration files with the correct information, e.g., the details of your NFTs and your email server (see instructions on [GitHub](https://github.com/Apillon/ps-proof-of-attendance)).

nftWhitelistClaim.name: Whitelist NFT Claim
nftWhitelistClaim.description: Instead of giving out NFTs for free, let users claim them and pay transaction fees.

content.content: This ready-to-use solution allows your audience to claim NFTs by covering transaction fees, instead of you distributing NFTs for free.

content.title: How does it work?
content: Users can claim NFTs only if their addresses are added to a list in your admin panel.
As admin, you can manage the admin panel and the list of addresses allowed to claim NFTs.

content.title: Before you start, you will need:
content: A smart contract allowing eligible users to claim NFTs

content.title: System setup
content: The front end is made with Vue.js,
The back end is made with Node.js and stores information in a MySQL database.

content.title: Options to run the system
content: You can run the front end on your computer, host it on any website provider, or use [Apillon's Web3 Hosting](/dashboard/service/hosting) service via the Apillon dashboard or GitHub actions.

You can run the back end on your computer or use a tool called Docker to set configuration files with the correct information, e.g., the details of your NFTs and your email server (see instructions on [GitHub](https://github.com/Apillon/ps-whitelist-claim)).

openGov.name: OpenGov WASM Proposal Airdrop
openGov.description: Send NFTs using WASM smart contract to Aye/Nay voters on an OpenGov proposal.

content.content: This ready-to-use solution allows you to distribute NFTs using a WASM smart contract to voters on Polkassembly OpenGov proposals.

content.title: How does it work?
content: On a simple webpage, enter the number of a proposal and the vote (Aye/Nay) you wish to reward with NFTs.
All the accounts that voted that way will be shown on a list you can edit.
Once you've finished editing the list, the NFTs will be sent to all the listed addresses.

content.title: Before you start, you need to:
content: Create an NFT collection using [Apillon NFT Service](/dashboard/service/nft),
Use an Ethereum-based digital wallet to access the admin panel,
Have [Apillon API key and secret](/dashboard/api-keys) to connect to the Apillon dashboard.
Know details about a specific OpenGov proposal.

content.title: System setup
content: The front end is made with Vue.js,
The back end is made with Node.js and stores information in a MySQL database.

content.title: Options to run the solution
content: You can run the front end on your computer, host it on any website provider, or use [Apillon's Web3 Hosting](/dashboard/service/hosting) service via the Apillon dashboard or GitHub actions.

You can run the back end on your computer or use a tool called Docker to set configuration files with the correct information, e.g., the details of your NFTs and your email server (see instructions on [GitHub](https://github.com/Apillon/ps-wasm-proposal-airdrop)).

benefits: Real-time Data Processing: Continuously indexes new blockchain data for immediate access.
Historical Data Access: Easily retrieve past blockchain data for analysis or verification.
Customizable APIs: Flexible API endpoints enable tailored querying for specific blockchain data needs.
Multi-Blockchain Support: Seamlessly index data across various blockchain networks.
Scalability: Efficiently handles large amounts of data, suitable for high-traffic applications.
